item.title: Coronavirus: People shielding in England allowed outdoors from Monday
item.description: Some restrictions on vulnerable people shielding from coronavirus are to be eased after 10 weeks.

item.title: George Floyd death: US cities order curfews amid widespread clashes
item.description: Police struggle to stem the violence as protesters take to the streets over the death of George Floyd.

item.title: Coronavirus: Drop plan to reopen primaries to all pupils, ministers urged
item.description: Aiming to have all pupils back piles uncertainty and pressure on school communities, say governors.

item.title: Trump delays 'outdated' G7 leaders' summit
item.description: The US president says he is postponing this year's meeting and wants to invite other leaders as well.

item.title: Coronavirus: Belgian Prince Joachim tests positive after lockdown party
item.description: Spanish police are investigating whether a party attended by Prince Joachim breached lockdown rules.

item.title: Coronavirus: Daily update as restrictions for vulnerable due to change
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak today.

item.title: US astronauts begin historic mission on private craft
item.description: Doug Hurley and Bob Behnken head out on a mission to initiate a new, commercial era in spaceflight.

item.title: Durdle Door: Three seriously hurt 'jumping off cliff into sea'
item.description: Police were called to Durdle Door over concerns for people seen jumping from the cliff into the sea.

item.title: Coronavirus: Pret a Manger plans rent talks in bid to avoid closures
item.description: The sandwich chain is "radically" changing its business model in the wake of the coronavirus epidemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Backlash after Trump signals US exit from WHO
item.description: The president is urged to reconsider, after accusing the health body of being a "puppet of China".

item.title: Sport returns: From Monday 1 June competitive sport allowed behind closed doors
item.description: The UK government approves the return of domestic competitive sport behind closed doors from Monday, 1 June.

item.title: Tributes to two men who died after Inverness disturbance
item.description: A man has been charged in connection with the deaths of Dwayne MacLeay, 28, and Gary MacKay, 35.

item.title: The Papers: Testing 'disgrace' and public's 'broken trust'
item.description: Britain's test and trace policy and Dominic Cummings' lockdown trip dominate Sunday's papers.

item.title: George Floyd death: Violence breaks out amid US protests
item.description: Images from street protests across the US on Saturday following the death of black man George Floyd.

item.title: George Floyd: ‘As a black American I am terrified’
item.description: After the death of George Floyd, young African-Americans in Minneapolis say they are scared for their safety.

item.title: Teepee built at East Bergholt school to allow social distancing
item.description: The structure was constructed by staff at an events company whose children attend the school.

item.title: Supernatural: The next-generation keep-fit coach?
item.description: Will virtual reality fitness classes lead a revolution in home workouts - or is it a passing craze?

item.title: Coronavirus: The self-isolation choir with worldwide members
item.description: This weekend thousands of people will gather as an online choir to perform Handel’s Messiah.

item.title: Coronavirus: Debenhams makes some restaurant employees redundant
item.description: Retailer Debenhams makes staff in some of its cafes redundant after going into administration.

item.title: Week in pictures: 23-29 May 2020
item.description: A selection of news photographs taken around the world this week.

item.title: Remi Wolf on how she makes music videos in lockdown
item.description: How rising star Remi Wolf made the promotional video for her new track in the middle of the pandemic.

item.title: DIY dentistry: What is safe to do to your own teeth?
item.description: How can you treat your own teeth while waiting to see a dentist?

item.title: In the middle of the Pacific with nowhere to land
item.description: A group of performers were halfway across the ocean in a 75ft boat when the pandemic erupted - leaving them with nowhere to go.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I'm high risk but made a full recovery'
item.description: Positive stories from people considered at high risk who have made a full recovery from coronavirus.

item.title: My Money: 'Our alternative quarantine holiday'
item.description: Alyssa Hulme from Utah in the US takes us through her weekly spending during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: In pictures: Peru's most catastrophic natural disaster
item.description: On 31 May 1970 an earthquake struck in Peru, triggering a landslide and leading to the deaths of 70,000.

item.title: Coronavirus: Independent cinemas unlikely to open before September
item.description: An Independent Cinema Office survey found only a quarter of venues planned to open before autumn.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: Why does Covid-19 make some healthy young people really sick?
item.description: Dr John Wright tells the story of Marium Zameer, who became very unwell with Covid-19 despite being young and healthy.

item.title: George Floyd death: Why has a US city gone up in flames?
item.description: Tensions in Minneapolis did not start with the death of George Floyd. They've been years in the making.

item.title: Coronavirus: School return plan 'like a jigsaw puzzle'
item.description: A head teacher explains how she is piecing school life back together before children return.

item.title: Bayern Munich 5-0 Fortuna Dusseldorf: Robert Lewandowski scores twice in rout
item.description: Robert Lewandowski scores twice against Fortuna Dusseldorf to equal his most prolific season as Bayern Munich move 10 points clear at the Bundesliga summit.

item.title: Preston's Stockley among positives in latest round of EFL Covid-19 testing
item.description: Preston say striker Jayden Stockley was one of 10 positive Covid-19 tests across eight Championship clubs returned in the latest round of testing.

item.title: Cricket finally returns - and match in Guernsey draws over 84,000 views on Youtube
item.description: The first match of the summer in the British Isles takes place in Guernsey to raise money for the Covid-19 appeal.

item.title: Sunday's gossip: Man Utd open to Juve's Rabiot as part of Pogba swap
item.description: Manchester United open to Adrien Rabiot swapping places with Paul Pogba, Lucas Torreira 'dreams' of Boca Juniors move, plus more.

item.title: Murrayfield favourite to stage home Lions Test
item.description: Murrayfield is the front-runner to stage a 'home' British and Irish Lions Test against Japan before next year's tour of South Africa.

item.title: How Johnson-Thompson overcame inner doubts to strike gold in Doha
item.description: In a special BBC programme, Katarina Johnson-Thompson looks back at how she became world champion in Doha last year.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the risks for children?
item.description: Children seem to be at low risk from the disease, but can they still spread it?

item.title: Coronavirus: Which schools are reopening for pupils?
item.description: Which children will be the first to go back to school, and what about the rest?

item.title: Social distancing: A practical guide to how to socialise now
item.description: Meeting friends? Here's how to handle the awkward new rules - from sharing food to avoiding hugs.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules on weddings?
item.description: There is a lot of uncertainty around when and how weddings are allowed to take place. What are your rights?

item.title: Will I still get paid if I have to self-isolate? And other questions
item.description: Will employees still get paid if they are told to self-isolate? And other questions answered by BBC experts.

item.title: All you need to know about new measures
item.description: How will social and work life be different after the easing of some restrictions around the UK?

item.title: Coronavirus: How safe is it to get on a plane?
item.description: Many airlines are planning to resume flying, but they first need to reduce the risks of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: What does it mean if I've been furloughed by work?
item.description: Millions unable to do their job due to coronavirus will have their wages paid by a new scheme.

item.title: Coronavirus: What help are self-employed getting from government?
item.description: What is being done for the five million self-employed people in the UK facing a sudden loss of income?

item.title: Coronavirus: We answer kids' questions about going back to school
item.description: The BBC's Education Editor Branwen Jeffreys answers kids' questions about going back to school.

item.title: Coronavirus: Dental practices to reopen from 8 June
item.description: Dental practices in England have been told they can reopen from Monday, 8 June.

item.title: Dominic Cummings: Fact-checking the row
item.description: Senior Conservatives are still questioning adviser's account of driving his family 260 miles during lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will contact tracing work in England?
item.description: Millions in the UK will soon be asked to monitor who they have been near to combat coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: What can you do in Scotland from Friday?
item.description: After almost 10 weeks of lockdown which restrictions are being eased - and which remain in force?

item.title: Dominic Cummings: Did he break lockdown rules?
item.description: The UK PM's most senior adviser has responded to accusations that he broke lockdown rules - what did he say?

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are being done in the UK?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Weather: The optical halos pictured during lockdown
item.description: BBC Weather presenter Cecilia Daly explains why there were sightings of this optical phenomenon.

item.title: Soul Boy: The teen who found a home on the dancefloor
item.description: Anthony Flavin spent most of his life in care - a turning point was finding soul on the dancefloor.

item.title: Thirsk woman, 99, to stand 100 times for son's hospice
item.description: As she turns 100, Joyce Richardson, of Thirsk, is raising funds for a hospice that cared for her son.

item.title: Claire Foy and Matt Smith to perform live in empty Old Vic theatre
item.description: The socially-distanced play, featuring The Crown actors, will be streamed live from the Old Vic.

item.title: How do you ease your dog out of lockdown?
item.description: Has your dog enjoyed your working from home too much? Separation anxiety could be an issue as the lockdown is lifted.
